headline: News Corp sued by Brave Software, a Google search engine rival
summary: (Reuters) -News Corp has been sued by Google search engine rival Brave Software, which seeks to forestall a lawsuit by Rupert Murdoch's company for when readers are directed to copyrighted articles from the Wall Street Journal and New York Post.  In a Wednesday night complaint filed in San Francisco federal court, Brave said News Corp sent a cease-and-desist letter threatening litigation and demanding compensation for the alleged misappropriation of copyrighted articles by "scraping" its websites and indexing their content.  Brave countered that it is "fair use" to index website content, "which all search engine operators must do to exist."

content.title: News Corp sued by Brave Software, a Google search engine rival

thumbnail.caption: A little girl runs in a shaft of light at the entrance to the News Corp. Building in the Midtown section of New York City
